featureList.name: Authorization Code
featureList.description: The Authorization Code grant type is used by confidential and public clients to exchange an authorization code for an access token.

featureList.name: Refresh Token
featureList.description: The Refresh Token grant type is used by clients to exchange a refresh token for an access token when the access token has expired.

featureList.name: Client Credentials
featureList.description: The Client Credentials grant type is used by clients to obtain an access token outside of the context of a user.

featureList.name: Implicit
featureList.description: The Implicit grant type is used by clients to obtain an access token directly from the authorization endpoint.

featureList.name: Token Exchange
featureList.description: The Token Exchange grant type is used by clients to exchange a token for another token.

featureList.name: Client Initiated BackChannel Authentication
featureList.description: The Client Initiated BackChannel Authentication grant type is used by clients to authenticate users using a backchannel.

featureList.name: Device Authorization Grant
featureList.description: The Device Authorization Grant is used by clients to obtain an access token on devices with limited input capabilities.

featureList.name: JWT Bearer Token
featureList.description: The JWT Bearer Token grant type is used by clients to exchange a JWT for an access token.

featureList.name: SAML 2.0 Bearer Assertion
featureList.description: The SAML 2.0 Bearer Assertion grant type is used by clients to exchange a SAML 2.0 assertion for an access token.

featureList.name: Resource Owner Password Credentials
featureList.description: The Resource Owner Password Credentials grant type is used by clients to exchange a user's credentials for an access token.

featureList.name: RP-initiated Logout
featureList.description: RP-initiated Logout is used by clients to log out users from the authorization server.

featureList.name: PKCE
featureList.description: Proof Key for Code Exchange (PKCE) is a security extension to OAuth 2.0 that protects authorization codes.

featureList.name: PAR
featureList.description: Pushed Authorization Requests (PAR) is a security extension to OAuth 2.0 that allows clients to push authorization requests to the authorization server.

featureList.name: RAR
featureList.description: Rich Authorization Requests (RAR) is a security extension to OAuth 2.0 that allows clients to request additional authorization information.

featureList.name: JAR
featureList.description: JWT Secured Authorization Requests (JAR) is a security extension to OAuth 2.0 that allows clients to sign authorization requests.

featureList.name: Authorization Endpoint
featureList.description: The Authorization Endpoint is used by clients to obtain authorization from the resource owner.

featureList.name: Token Endpoint
featureList.description: The Token Endpoint is used by clients to obtain an access token and refresh token.

featureList.name: UserInfo Endpoint
featureList.description: The UserInfo Endpoint is used by clients to obtain user information.

featureList.name: Token Revocation
featureList.description: OAuth 2.0 Token Revocation is a security feature that allows clients to revoke access tokens and refresh tokens.

featureList.name: Token Introspection
featureList.description: OAuth 2.0 Token Introspection is a security feature that allows clients to validate access tokens and refresh tokens.

featureList.name: OpenID Connect Discovery Endpoint
featureList.description: Mechanism for an OpenID Connect Relying Party to discover the OpenID Provider and obtain information needed to interact with it.

featureList.name: OAuth 2.0 Authorization Server Metadata Endpoint
featureList.description: A metadata format that an OAuth 2.0 client can use to obtain the information needed to interact with an OAuth 2.0 authorization server.

featureList.name: none
featureList.description: The none prompt is used to request that the authorization server does not display any user interface.

featureList.name: login
featureList.description: The login prompt is used to request that the authorization server displays a login user interface.

featureList.name: consent
featureList.description: The consent prompt is used to request that the authorization server displays a consent user interface.

featureList.name: select_account
featureList.description: The select_account prompt is used to request that the authorization server displays an account selection user interface.

featureList.name: create
featureList.description: The create prompt is used to request that the authorization server displays a user interface to create a new account.

featureList.name: none
featureList.description: The none token endpoint authentication method is used to request that the client does not authenticate with the token endpoint.

featureList.name: client_secret_basic
featureList.description: The client_secret_basic use HTTP Basic authentication with the client ID and client secret to authenticate with the token endpoint.

featureList.name: client_secret_post
featureList.description: The client_secret_post use the client ID and client secret in the request body to authenticate with the token endpoint.

featureList.name: client_secret_jwt
featureList.description: The client_secret_jwt use JWT signed with the client secret to authenticate with the token endpoint.

featureList.name: private_key_jwt
featureList.description: The private_key_jwt use JWT signed with the client private key to authenticate with the token endpoint.

featureList.name: tls_client_auth
featureList.description: The tls_client_auth use TLS client authentication to authenticate with the token endpoint.

featureList.name: Dynamic Client Registration
featureList.description: Dynamic Client Registration enables clients to register with the authorization server.

featureList.name: Refresh Token Rotation
featureList.description: Refresh Token Rotation is a security feature that allows the authorization server to issue a new refresh token with every access token request.
